content.title: Pension Scheme for the Journalists
content.department: Tamil Development, Religious Endowment & Information Department
content.details: The 'Pension Scheme for the Journalists' was launched by the Tamil Development, Religious Endowments, and Information Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to give a monthly pension to retired journalists who fit with the eligibility criteria.
eligibility: The applicant should be a retired journalist.
The age of the applicant should be 58 years or above.
The applicant should have worked full-time for 20 years in one of the posts of teacher, assistant teacher, reporter, photographer, proofreader, or news correspondent.
10 years of journalism experience is sufficient if the applicant is terminally ill or physically disabled.
The applicant's annual family income should not exceed ₹20,000/-.
The applicant received gratuity and pension from previous companies should not exceed ₹30,000/-.
In any year when the applicant was employed, their income should not exceed ₹50,000/-.
content.application_process: Offline. The interested applicant can download the application form from the official website. Fill in all mandatory fields, attach copies of all mandatory documents, and submit to the Tamil Development, Religious Endowment & Information Department.
documents_required: Two Passport-size Photographs (to be countersigned by a Government Registered Officer).
Certificates related to post and place of service.
Gratuity Certificate (received on retirement of the applicant).
Income Certificate (maximum annual income and other income earned during employment).
Certificates if he/she receives a Central-State Government Pension.
Current Annual Income Certificate (to be obtained from the Office of the Governor).
Medical Certificate (Government Hospital or Registered Medical Practitioner).
Photograph of Spouse (for grant of family pension to the first surviving spouse of the pensioner in case of death).

faqs.question: What is the Journalists Pension Scheme?
faqs.answer: A pension scheme providing ₹4000/- monthly to retired journalists in indigent circumstances.

faqs.question: Which department oversees the Journalists Pension Scheme?
faqs.answer: Tamil Development, Religious Endowment & Information Department.

faqs.question: Who funds the Journalists Pension Scheme?
Who are the beneficiaries of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The Retired journalists who have served for 20 years and are in indigent circumstances.

faqs.question: Is there any specific community or age requirement for this scheme?
faqs.answer: There are no specific community requirements, but the applicant must be at least 58 years old.

faqs.question: Are there any special conditions for journalists who are terminally ill or physically disabled?
faqs.answer: Yes, terminally ill or physically disabled applicants need only 10 years of journalism experience to qualify.

faqs.question: How can one apply for the Journalists Pension Scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants must apply to the Tamil Development, Religious Endowment & Information Department.

faqs.question: How long is the scheme valid for?
faqs.answer: The scheme does not specify an end date, so it is assumed to be ongoing unless otherwise stated by the government.

faqs.question: How many journalists have benefited from the scheme so far?
faqs.answer: As of the latest update, 62 journalists have benefited from the scheme.

faqs.question: What income criteria must applicants meet to be eligible for the pension?
faqs.answer: The applicant's annual family income should not exceed ₹20,000 at the time of application. The total amount received through gratuity and pension from previous employers should not exceed ₹30,000, and in any year of employment, the applicant's income should not have exceeded ₹50,000.
